poem:
**Dark Indulgence**

In winter's shadow, bitter sweet relief,  
a bite of dark cacao, deeper than belief.  
Friends shed their sugar coats, slimming their desires,  
yet the 80% caress, ignites forgotten fires.  
In this dim season, we taste the night,  
a morsel, a whisper—chocolate, our small light.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Notes on chocolate: the best dark choc for this dark time of year So here we are. Through the other side. Despite my protestations that deep winter is not the time for deprivation, I have several friends on diets and attempted overhauls of their lives. Luckily, none have given up chocolate completely, but some of them are opting for the 80% and over. Occasionally, I cleanse my palate by – gasp – not eating chocolate,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
